purpleculture_pinyin:
liú
precious stone
драгоценный камень
rtega_mnemonic:
瑠瑠RS璢琉precious stone
  • stop work in the field 留/畱 to look at a precious stone 玉
  • uncultivated 㐬 person looking at a precious stone 玉
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 㐬 indicates the sound; 王 (jade) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
阿喀琉斯 [ ā kā liú sī ]: Achilles (or Akhilleus or Achilleus), son of Thetis and Peleus, Greek hero central to the Iliad
琉球 [ liú qiú ]: Ryūkyū; refers to the Ryūkyū Islands 琉球群岛 , Taiwan
琉球群岛 [ liú qiú qún dǎo ]: Ryukyu islands; Okinawa 冲绳 and other islands of modern Japan
琉球乡 [ liú qiú xiāng ]: Liuchiu township in Pingtung County 屏东县 , Taiwan
琉璃 [ liú li ]: colored glass; ceramic glaze
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 王 [ wáng ] king, ruler; royal; surname
    • 㐬 [ liú ] pennant; wild, barren, uncultivated
heisig_chinese_memo: The king stopped feeding his baby donuts with glaze because it would end up creating too much infant doodie.
Ru_AutoNotes:
Лазурит (ляпис-лазурь) — непрозрачный минерал от синего до голубовато-серого или зеленовато-серого цвета, лучшими считают камни сочно синие или сине-фиолетовые, а также насыщенно голубые.

Лазурит из Афганистана в естественном виде

Из него изготовляют декоративные вазы, шкатулки, статуэтки, применяют для инкрустации в художественных мозаичных работах, а также для облицовки колонн, каминов и др.

Фигурка из лазурита
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 琉 (リュウ、ル драгоценный камень, лазурит), 瑠 (ル、リュウ лазурит, ляпис-лазурь, лазуревый камень), 璃 (リ лазурит, лазуревый камень; стекло).
Ru_Words:
琉球りゅうきゅう
  • (See 沖縄・1) Ryukyu, chain of southwestern Japanese islands comprising Okinawa Prefecture
    • edict2
    琉璃るり
  • lapis lazuli
  • (See 瑠璃色) lapis lazuli (color)
  • (See 吠瑠璃) beryl
  • (See 小瑠璃,大瑠璃,瑠璃鶲) mall blue passerine bird (esp. the blue-and-white flycatcher and the Siberian blue robin, but also the red-flanked bluetail)
  • glass
    • edict2
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 厶 (значок МУ), 川 (река), 王 (монарх)
Ru_trainchinese: liú: (графема) яркий гладкий камень; покрытый глазурью
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the king's (王) private lidded river (㐬) contains lapis lazuli
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The king stopped feeding his baby donuts with glaze because it would end up creating too much infant doodie.
humanum_full_description_en:
Save the sound from " Jade " and " Flow ". "Liu Li" is a kind of jade with smooth color, also known as "Rui", "Biliu", "Bi 𤥗 (珋)" and so on. "Suowen" has no " Liu ", "Jade Department": "𤥗, the stone has light, and it is also out of Xihu." Duan Yucai's note: "Bi𤥗, that is, the exile of Bi... The proverbial word is "displacement", and the word is changed to Ruli. The ancients proverbially refers to "bi 𤥗." An example is the "Book of the Later Han." Biography of the Western Regions. "Da Qin": "The earth is rich in gold and silver precious treasures, including luminous bi, moon pearl, horror, coral, amber, colored glaze, Langgan, Zhu Dan, and Qingbi." "Luoyang Jialan. West of the city. "Kaishan Temple": "Self-surplus wine vessels, there are dozens of crystal bowls, agate glass bowls, and red jade wares."

"Glazed tiles" also means glazed tiles, also known as "glazed tiles". Such as "Ming History. Li Zhi. "The System of the Altar": "The Zhai Palace is in the outer wall and in the southwest, facing east, and its back hall is tiled with green colored glaze." Kong Shangren in the Qing Dynasty "Peach Blossom Fan. "After Rhyme": "Broken glass, many tiles, rotten jade, and few window lattices."
humanum_short_description_en: From " Jade ", " Flow " to save the sound. "Liu Li" is a kind of jade with smooth color.
humanum_full_description:
從「玉」，「流」省聲。「琉璃」是一種色澤光潤的玉石，又名「瑠璃」、「璧流離」、「璧𤥗（珋）」等。《說文》無「琉」，〈玉部〉：「𤥗，石之有光，璧𤥗也，出西胡中。」段玉裁注：「璧𤥗，即璧流離也。……今人省言之曰流離，改其字爲瑠璃。古人省言之曰璧𤥗。」例子如《後漢書．西域傳．大秦》：「土多金銀奇寶，有夜光璧、明月珠、駭雞犀、珊瑚、琥珀、琉璃、琅玕、朱丹、青碧。」《洛陽伽藍記．城西．開善寺》：「自餘酒器，有水晶鉢、瑪瑙琉璃碗、赤玉卮數十枚。」

　　「琉璃」也表示塗釉的瓦片，又稱「琉璃瓦」。如《明史．禮志．壇壝之制》：「齋宮在外垣內西南，東向，其後殿瓦易青琉璃。」清代孔尚任《桃花扇．餘韻》：「碎琉璃，瓦片多，爛翡翠，窗欞少。」
humanum_short_description: 從「玉」，「流」省聲。「琉璃」是一種色澤光潤的玉石。

琉字的基本解释

琉
liú
〔琉璃〕一种用铝和钠的硅酸化合物烧制的釉料，多为绿色或金黄色，用于烧制砖瓦、缸、盆以及一些工艺品（“
璃”读轻声）。

琉字的汉语字典释义
琉字的康熙字典解释
琉字的源字形
琉字的起名意思

用铝和钠的硅酸化合物烧制成的釉料，常见的有绿色和金黄色两种，多加在粘土的外层，烧制成缸、盆、砖瓦等。亦指琉璃灯座。

Liu
Basic explanation of words
Liu
liú
[Glass] A glaze made of a silicic acid compound of aluminum and sodium, mostly green or golden yellow, used to make bricks, urns, pots, and some crafts ("
"Li" read softly).
Liu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
Liu
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
Liu
Source glyph
Liu
Name meaning
Glazes made by firing silicic acid compounds of aluminum and sodium are commonly available in green and golden yellow. They are often added to the outer layer of clay and fired into urns, basins, bricks, etc. Also refers to the glass lamp holder.
liú
I сущ.
блестящий камень; стекло
琉态 стекловидное состояние
II собств.
геогр. (сокр. вм. 琉球) архипелаг Люцю (Рюкю)
米琉 рис с островов Люцю
